intro: Strigilia alba, commonly known as the white strigil, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in late spring, adding a subtle elegance to its appearance. Strigilia alba thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial shade, making it a challenging but rewarding plant for cultivation. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is often found in protected natural areas.
